triples.name: Sliding mode control
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel sliding mode control approach for networked fuzzy systems with observer-based implementation.

triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: The paper applies Takagi-Sugeno fuzzy control methods to address singularly perturbed networked systems.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: The core problem domain where control signals are transmitted through a communication network with bandwidth constraints.

triples.name: Singular perturbation
triples.relevance: The paper handles systems with singularly perturbed parameters using a multi-scale dynamics approach.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: Observer-based control design is used to estimate system states for feedback control when direct measurement is unavailable.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: The paper employs Lyapunov approach to establish asymptotic stability conditions for the control system.

triples.name: H-infinity methods in control theory
triples.relevance: H-infinity performance specifications are achieved to guarantee robust control with bounded error bounds.

triples.name: Convex optimization
triples.relevance: Convex optimization theory is utilized to develop sufficient conditions and solve for controller parameters.

triples.name: Quantization (signal processing)
triples.relevance: A logarithmic quantizer is synthesized to process measurement outputs and reduce network bandwidth requirements.
